critique: This document is an executive order focused on preventing the use of forced or indentured child labor in the production of goods imported into the United States or used in federal procurement. It directs executive agencies to enforce laws against such practices, publish lists of products potentially made with child labor, and implement procurement regulations to ensure contractors certify they are not using forced child labor. The order also outlines investigation and remedy procedures, including contract termination and debarment. It includes some exceptions for countries party to certain trade agreements.
